text:
Brett Ratner (born March 28, 1969) is an American director and producer. He is known for directing the "Rush Hour" movie series, "The Family Man", "Red Dragon", ', and "Tower Heist".
Ratner is the co-founder of RatPac Entertainment, a movie production and financing company.
On January 19, 2017, Ratner received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for his works to the motion picture industry.
In late 2017, seven women, including actresses Olivia Munn and Natasha Henstridge, accused Ratner of sexual misconduct and harassment.
